Author: paleairity
Text: My personal theory is the stomach is like a stew, the heaviest thing sinks to the bottom despite being most recently eaten or whatever. Cookies are heavier than salad, so perhaps thatâ€™s why it came up first. Regardless I totally feel the struggle of purging lettuce, mine has often been from the previous day too like wtf

Author: tea-addicted-taemint
Text: I feel this, it's happened to me. I theorize that the sugars etc in cookies (or ice cream, cereal etc) get broken down really quickly, whereas fibrous foods (vegetables) and fats (dressing) take longer. Which is why I get visible veg chunks covered in sweetish liquid.   I hope you can safely hydrate and replenish your electrolytes, it's not fun to get salad up.
